heisigComment: * The primitive keeps the same meaning and connotation as the kanji.
heisigStory: Just as the word evening adds a touch of formality or romanticism to the ordinary word "night," so the kanji for evening takes the ordinary looking moon in the night sky and has a cloud pass over it (as we saw in the last frame).
koohiiStory1: The evening is young, the moon is not full.
koohiiStory2: In the evening, I try my best to remember the katakana symbol for "TA" (ie. "ta ta!").
